column4: zenwryly: there are still a few issues with Ext4 that are menitoned in the 9.04 release notes, but it should be good enough for most users,   but to be sure they should back up  stuff elsewhere as well
oh  the bot has gone bye bye or something
the bot has gone for a walk
no. But its owner is aware and presumablt working his ass of to get the bot back
it tries to bite but fails
(the damn you refered to you beating me to the correct answer by one line of chat :))
well learn to touch type if you don't know how already, and you might be able to beat me  sometime :D
I actually had to look up where it lived, I have it bound to [flag key] + T so I never use the menu to find it :)
you can get a few programs for that from the Ubuntu repo by the way
:)  yep that's what I was on about,  and I assumed that could also be done on OS X
I guess so. It has a terminal with a bsd-based-ish userland. Wouldn't be surprised if it has an md5sum command :)
meh, it's in a good ppa (mozillateam knows what they do) so just use it ;)

well  having to add ppa's in the first place (or install the software some other way) for  major later stuff, Firefox, Open Office, etc, or  wait for the next release, is a bit silly really, but whatever I guess. Also some users will find it difficult to add a ppa.
